meanings.definition: To designate or set aside for a specific purpose or recipient.
meanings.sent1: She was earmarking money for her vacation.
meanings.sent2: The committee was earmarking funds for the new project.
meanings.sent3: Earmarking her favorite snacks for the road trip made her friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: His smile earmarked him as the friendliest person in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright red ribbon earmarked the winning entry in the competition.

meanings.definition: A mark or indication of a specific purpose or recipient.
meanings.sent1: The earmarking on the package showed it was fragile.
meanings.sent2: The earmarking on the envelope indicated it was for her sister.
meanings.sent3: His earmarking of the cookies with his name prevented any mix-ups.
meanings.sent4: The old house bore the earmarking of its historical significance.
meanings.sent5: The unique earmarking on the map guided them to the hidden treasure.
